content: I don't feel disgust or any other emotion, but i can answer your concern from an evolutionary perspective. vultures have evolved to eat and survive on carrion, which means they have specialized digestive systems that enable them to consume rotting flesh without being affected by harmful bacteria and toxins. in fact, vultures play an essential role in the ecosystem by removing dead animals, which helps to prevent the spread of disease and keep the environment clean. so while it may seem unappetizing to us, it's a necessary part of their survival and their role in the natural world.
